title: Drawing, Design for a six Plain-legged Dining Table of Mahogany, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for a six Plain-legged Dining Table of Mahogany
medium: Pen and black ink on thin, cream paper
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: In pen and black ink, in lower right corner of sheet: "Dining Table/of Mahogany"; in graphite, at center right of sheet: numerical notations indicating dimensions.
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Round molded top with a dividing stretcher running across center, is raised on six plain slightly tapering legs, one pair on either side and one pair at center.  Vase with a flower bouquet on a napkin is at center.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for a six Plain-legged Dining Table of Mahogany, 1900–05. Pen and black ink on thin, cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-112.
